decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies by taxing their resources and making it difficult for them to execute their game plan. This is achieved through cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Additionally, the deck has a strong aggro component with creatures like Blade Splicer and Thought-Knot Seer putting pressure on the opponent. The deck also has some flicker effects to provide value and protect key pieces, along with removal in the form of Path to Exile.Overall, the deck aims to control the game while also presenting a fast clock to win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Human tribe synergies to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. The key strategy involves quickly establishing a board presence using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. By leveraging the mana acceleration provided by Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure on the opponent and close out the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to control the board with cards like Cryptic Command and Terminate, while also generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Engineered Explosives allows for graveyard hate and flexible removal options. The deck is designed to outlast the opponent's threats and eventually take over the game through powerful late-game finishers like Cruel Ultimatum.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and triggering its ability multiple times in a single turn to deal massive damage to the opponent. The main combo is using Scapeshift to sacrifice lands and search for Valakut and Mountains, while also using Primeval Titan to search for more lands. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of Valakut triggers and win the game in a single turn. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Prismatic Omen to ensure all lands are Mountains for maximum damage output.

The deck revolves around aggressive play and disruption, utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells and hand disruption to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of early threats like Young Pyromancer and Bomat Courier, while generating card advantage with spells like Faithless Looting and Bedlam Reveler. The deck's versatility allows it to adapt to different matchups and maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

This deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate large amounts of mana. It utilizes various color fixing cards like Chromatic Star and Chromatic Sphere to ramp and find key pieces. The deck includes removal like Fatal Push and board wipes like Oblivion Stone to deal with threats. It also features strong finishers like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated to secure the game. The deck seeks to disrupt opponents while establishing a dominant board presence.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base using land destruction spells like Stone Rain and Mwonvuli Acid-Moss, while ramping up its own mana with Utopia Sprawl and mana dorks like Arbor Elf and Birds of Paradise. It also aims to control the board with cards like Blood Moon and Beast Within, while generating card advantage through Tireless Tracker. The deck closes out the game with powerful threats like Thragtusk, Stormbreath Dragon, Inferno Titan, and Chameleon Colossus.

The Golgari Aggro deck focuses on using efficient removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. This deck utilizes cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Tarmogoyf to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo. Cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil provide card advantage and further increase the pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent while also quickly closing out the game with its aggressive creatures and versatile removal spells.

This UWx Midrange deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and versatile creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats like Geist of Saint Traft and Celestial Colonnade. By efficiently managing resources and carefully choosing when to be aggressive or defensive, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a long game. Serum Visions and Search for Azcanta help ensure smooth draws and consistent access to key cards, making this deck a versatile and resilient choice in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing a combination of Eldrazi Temple and ramp lands, the deck can deploy threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher ahead of schedule. Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail provide disruption while Walking Ballista and Karn Liberated offer flexible removal options. The goal of the deck is to apply early pressure and maintain board control through efficient use of resources.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the deck to play powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to deal with opponent's threats and disrupt their game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and powerful abilities while controlling the game to secure a win.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells and removal spells while deploying threats that can generate value and provide a clock. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to stabilize the board and take over the game with powerful threats like Vendilion Clique, Spell Queller, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. The deck also includes versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel to generate additional value and provide flexibility in dealing with various threats.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Reality Smasher. It also includes removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck can apply pressure early with creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Walking Ballista, while also having late-game threats like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and efficient removal to win the game quickly.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and resources through discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, as well as by utilizing cards like Raven's Crime and Wrench Mind to keep the opponent off balance. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Dismember and Fatal Push, while utilizing cards like The Rack and Shrieking Affliction to slowly chip away at the opponent's life total. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and value, while Smallpox can disrupt the opponent's mana base and resources.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a fast tempo and massive board presence. By utilizing artifact creatures and mana acceleration, it aims to equip Cranial Plating to deal massive damage quickly. Cards like Steel Overseer and Master of Etherium boost the power of the creatures, making them even more threatening. This deck is all about aggressive early-game plays and using synergy between artifacts to dominate the battlefield and secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing the Human creature type to take advantage of tribal synergies. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up creatures, along with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control on the battlefield. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Reflector Mage provide additional tempo advantage.
